column3: Cold snap (around 0 degrees Celsius). Every creature without appropriate clothing, shelter or a source of heat must make a DC 10 Constitution save or suffer a level of exhaustion per 2 hours. Creatures with resistance or immunity to cold damage suffer no affects. A cold snap lasts 48 hours.

Rain. Every square or kilometre of movement costs an additional square or kilometre of movement. Disadvantage on Constitution checks caused by cold weather. Rain lasts until the next overland travel roll.

Heavy Rain. Every square or kilometre of movement costs 2 additional squares or kilometres of movement. Disadvantage on range attacks, perception checks. Disadvantage on Constitution checks caused by cold weather. Visibility (for torches, dark vision, etc.) is halved. Heavy rain lasts until the next overland travel roll.

Torrential Downpour. Every square or kilometre of movement costs 3 additional squares or kilometres of movement. Disadvantage on Constitution checks caused by cold weather. Visibility (for torches, dark vision, etc.) is reduced to one quarter. Torrential downpour lasts until the next overland travel.
